poem:
### Turnaround

In New Orleans' shadow,  
echoes of faith falter—  
an expert questioned,  
his ledger of doubt  
hangs heavy. Survivors  
wait, wary of promises  
stitched with golden thread.  
Hope is a quiet hymn,  
lost among whispers,  
seeking sunlight  
in sanctuaries rebuilt,  
one brick, one prayer  
at a time.
